newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Merrill Lynch wants in on Manila peso bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch wants in on Manila peso bond issue.

text.p: A Philippine Central bank official said on Tuesday that Merrill Lynch had become the third international investment house to express interest in lead managing an inaugural Philippine peso eurobond issue.

The U.S.-based institution had proposed a similar sized "europeso" issue, of 1.3 to 2.0 billon pesos, as the two earlier proposals, Cristina Que-Orbetta, director of the bank's management of external debt department, told reporters.
The other two institutions were Deutsche Morgan Grenfell and ING-Barings.
Que-Orbetta said the bank was considering the proposals and would particularly have to weigh the impact of such an issue on the peso market.
Although committed to an open foreign exchange market, the bank maintains a constant vigil on the peso and frequently intervenes to prevent sharp fluctuations.
